reviews.review_msg: Michael is an alright prof. He's really nice but he often goes off topic during lectures which makes them really boring. The final is a take-home assignment where you have to write an essay in two days.
He's a good professor and I loved having him. TAs were a bit difficult on the grading but a few minor adjustments improved the grading as well

Michael is a lovely person. He's very friendly and passionate, but his slides are often difficult to understand on their own. He didn't post them and used no templates (they were literally just a white screen with text), so they weren't necessarily engaging. Overall I had a positive experience with the course but the lectures were boring at times.

Michael is a lovely person. He's very friendly and passionate. That being said, his slides were often difficult to understand, since they were simplified bullet points that he expands on verbally. He doesn't post them and used no template for them (it was literally just  writing on a white screen), so they're not necessarily engaging.

Was not engaging at all, did not seem to care about anything other than his mushrooms that he researched. Very bad at responding to emails and would respond by saying to ask the TA instead of offering any sort of guidence.

Professor Hathaway is very kind; however, Vaughn (one of the 2 TAs) was the star of the show. If you are lucky enough to have Vaughn as a TA, please appreciate his patience, kindness and fair grading. There are many TA's out there like him. Also, the lecture wasn't mandatory, but Hathaway doesn't post slides, so I recommend attending each lecture.
Just okay. Didn't learn much. Prof was not engaged throughout the semester, didn't seem to care much about getting students into anthropology, didn't seem to teach much.
seemed to be preoccupied. appear to be super nice, but lectures are super superficial. forgot to reply emails.
I made valuable memories and learned a lot about anthropology in his awesome class!

He was a nice professor and was clearly very passionate about what he was teaching. However he didn't upload slides at all so you have to go lecture or read the textbook. The class was boring at times but not too difficult

I just didn't learn much in this class. Lectures are often taken up by long videos and class discussions involving many random examples. When a big chunk of lectures are taken up by allowing 5+ people to share their specific experiences for each point, it's not a lot of specific concepts being taught. The concepts were also very abstract at times.

He is one of the BEST professors in SFU. Be prepared to read a lot, but they are not hard reads, as long as you have some interests in indigenous issues. He listens to every students' points and opinions, and he takes notes of them. He also has lots of things to offer, so you can actually learn a lot from him.

Really nice prof. You need to come to class prepared to speak and to have read the material because participation is so important. Not just a skim read either-- read the material in depth and have something to say about it.

Prof Hathaway was the BEST! The work load was super light, the work was super easy and was the nicest person!! I would recommend this class to everyone. Its an easy A, the prof is awesome and its pretty interesting!!  nicest guy ever!!

Took this course last semester. The professor is very nice, clear in his slides although his talking wonders around sometimes. Make sure you have a good relationship with the TA. Relate the assignments to your personal life and show your interest in the assignments. You will be guaranteed a good score! Got A+ :)

Really disappointed I got a B. I felt I did pretty well and I was really into the course, it was just my mid-term mark that I still don't know why I got a bad grade. I probably should have asked, but whatever. Overall, this is an easy course. I sleep during his lectures and stay awake for the films he shows. The tutorials are what matters the most.

Rambly lectures with too many boring discussions, rarely did more than go over the readings. Movies were good at first but got boring. Assignments were ridiculous and the final is essentially a worthless paper. Either discuss textbooks too little or too much. Only bright spot was the midterm. Wouldn't take him again.
Although not mandatory, his lectures are fantastic. Assignments are also genuinely interesting, and exams are fairly easy. Great first year course!

His lectures are great in my opinion, with Power Point presentations, in class discussions and movies at the end, that I find interesting and bring a perspective to the class. He interacts with the students and answers questions readily which is great! Only complaint is I found two-hour tutorials to be really long.
Not the most organized prof, too many movies in class, speeds through powerpoints so it's hard to take notes, and not always clear. Nice guy though with funny stories related to anthropology.

This class was pretty cool, he showed videos and the text book was okay. There was way too much reading though! It was like 80 pages a week which was a lot. I didn't finish the readings any week and did virtually no readings after the midterm and got a B+. Just attend lecture and tutorials and pay attention and you should do okay :)

Dr. Hathaway is interested in his subject material, and is very approachable, but I almost found his lectures to be irrelevant. I feel like I got more out of the tutorials than I did out of lectures (which were half video clips anyway). I wish he spent more time discussing the content of our readings. Go to class to make video notes though!
He is helpful and non-threatening and is interested in students inputs.

Holy. Do not take this class unless you are very passionate about Native culture and are a socio major. I took it as a requirement for WQB and I'm really regretting it. The material is way too difficult and it is not for anyone who is not passionate about socio or anthro.
enthusisastic about his topic but i feel there was no substance in his lecture it seems he was talking so much but nothing illuminating coming out.

Michael Hathaway is a great prof. His lectures were interactive and often included movies and video clips. He also spoke a lot about his own research, offering new perspectives and providing a different angle on course material. Slides and recordings do not go online, so attendance is mandatory.

Micheal was an awesome prof! He includes films and movies into his lecture. His exams are easy too since he doesn't require you to do all of the questions. He only requires you to answer part of it. I would take his classes again =)

M.Hathaway is one of the best at SFU. His SA 101 class was one of the best electives I've taken. There is only one MT and 3 papers. The TAs are very helpful and nice. He likes to engage his students and get them thinking. The textbooks are very interesting, the movies get you thinking outside the box and his notes are very good. Hez simply AMAZING!

He loves to engage with his students,experienced in his field of study,and he has lots of personal stories to share. Not much note-taking, just a lot of understanding basic, common-sense concepts. If you're looking for a easy mark,take this course! The only downside is the massive amount of textbook reading you have to do. His ponytail is cool too.

Hathaway is a very engaging professor. His lectures are pretty informal, and there are often videos to watch. The textbook is easy to read and supplementary material is engaging. The only downside is that there is so little content during lectures, when it comes to exam time you wonder what to study (and it is all written answers).

Michael is a really cool prof and conducts interesting, thought-provoking lectures. However...the lecture was at 8:30 in the morning, and I hardly attended, yet still got an A. Most of the material covered on the exams is from the textbooks, which are all excellent. Lisa was an incredible TA as well. This class should NOT be 4 credits...

This class was easy but I was left feeling like I did not learn anything. I usually like seminar style courses but there was too much of a focus on group discussions and he did not clarify difficult concepts. He is a nice person its just not a great class.

He is a pretty interesting prof as he always gets us to do group discussion and watch videos. There are a lot of readings, but i always do them the last min before the exam and still do good on them. If you have Pepita for TA, your gonna love her!
He is interested in his subject; however, his lectures could have been done in less than an hour. Be prepared for group discussion. If you get Pepita as a TA you are golden.

This is an interesting class and must be  difficult class to teach because 'anthropology' has a lot of facets and you can't really teach that. However Hathaway does a great job using examples to show you what it's all about. A good TA is key and do the readings! But I really enjoyed this class and plan on minoring in Anthro now!

The material was very interesting but his teaching style is not instructive. Most of the time is wasted in pointless group discussion, he rarely spends more than 30 mins lecturing. The course isn't particularly hard, but you only learn something in the first 1.5 hours so the other 1.5 are a waste of time and money.
A truly wonderful class! Micheal really helps explain concepts being discussed. I looked foward to attending. Very interesting. Highly recommended!

I think he's a fairly new prof, and it shows. Lectures were unorganized and uninformative, and often turned into pointless group discussions. They definitely didn't have to be 3 hours long. If interested in anthropology, maybe you'll enjoy the course, but if you just need some b-soc. credits (like me), avoid at all costs.

Michael is a fantastic teacher. He has an obvious passion for anthropology, and he definitely knows his stuff. The midterm will be very easy if you pay attention in lecture/read the books. The final was brutal, but fair. Also, Michael also looks like a stereotypical anthropologist, which makes it all that much more interesting!!

Micheal is a great prof who makes class very interesting by stimulating a lot class disscusion. His notes are all powerpoint and are not posted on the web. Exams are pretty straightforward and fair. As long as you go to lectures you will be fine. Pepita is an awesome TA she really helped make things clear. Overall great course!

Micheal is an awesome prof. who relates his materials and teachings to the real world and helps his students understand better. Lots of information that could get a littel confusing at times but Pepita was an awesome prof who really helped make things clear, you need to be interested in the course material to do well in class. Overall great course!

His class is good. The prof is organized, but he never puts the notes on the web. Movies and readings can be boring sometimes, the materials like the culture stuff are interesting though. TA is helpful, I love Kate! The ethnographic exercises are easy. The mid-term and final are not really hard. The only thing is I dont like reading the ethnography

i would say that he is a BAD prof.. materials and lecture notes are unclear. boring lecture!!!! reading are boring ... the group discussion during lecture is very useless!!! not recommend people to take this course if he is teaching
wasn't very clear. interested in the course though. i would not recommend this course if he is teaching it.

WELL...not very good,the lecture part is really boring,but he is very organized on the course outline and the main topic of the tutorial.The TA were sucks,can't explained clear and even can't remember what the textbook said.MT and final exam is all about your own idea and understanding of the issue,no multiple choice questions,all about writting!

I actually loved this class... I would go even if I was sick that week.... The prof is great and the TA's are too the work wasnt too hard and the prof made it clear to what the major themes were. Majority of the time I wouldnt read the texts and got all the main ideas from the lecture... Take this class with Hathaway!! He's great!

i loved this class; very interesting and kept my attention for 3 hours which is amazing.,awesome TAs, great course. highly suggest this class if you have any interest in it. films in class were very relevant and interesting.HIGHLY RECOMMEND! :)

A very good prof.  Lectures are interesting and include a lot of discussion, and all the TAs were excellent.  Good choices for ethnographic reading and films, but the Delaney course textbook was terribly written.  The interaction encouraged in class is this course's strong point.
No Comments

He's a good teacher and could get boring at times. His midterm and final could be tough if english is your second or third language. Textbooks are overall decent; honestly, some of them could be really boring and repeat and overexaggerate things too much.
If your a first year interested in Anthropology, take 101 with this guy. He is good, I found him to be a good guy who knows his**** and made class pretty interesting.
